title.narrative: Greening 1000 telecommunication towers for PNG - a fuel switch project

description.narrative: This project is aligned with IO2. Increased green growth investment flows which enable partner governments to implement green growth policies.
This project is aligned with IO2. Increased green growth investment flows which enable partner governments to implement green growth policies.

mailing-address.narrative: Global Green Growth Institute, 19F Jeongdong Bldg., 21-15 Jeongdong-gil, Jung-gu Seoul 04552 Republic of Korea

title.narrative: Technical and financial services used for the implementation of RE solutions for telecom towers be used for widespread implementation of rooftop solar especially linked to government buildings, airports etc.

description.narrative: No of implementations and movement in solar deployment post GGGI developed project

title.narrative: Total volume of green growth financing catalyzed with GGGI’s support, disaggregated by public and private investment.

Increased investment in sustainable energy deployment. The RE industry is matured (efficient sustainable green technologies adopted, switch to renewable energy and good operations management) by industries in PNG Overall Objective: Increased efficiencies in the energy systems and decreased environmental impact towards energy production for the country

description.narrative: Policies for RE projects are well established, a single window for RE deployment is created and the utility company can benefit from reduced cost of electricity production and more stable energy supplies.

title.narrative: Vanuatu - Telecom providers have access to appropriate technical and financial services for greening their network centers (telecom towers) that are currently diesel fueled, in remote locations and incur heavy logistics cost

description.narrative: Technically viable solar PV based solution proven and investment committed for the suggested implementation. Investment ticket estimated @ US$2-3M for viable implementation sites

title.narrative: Number of completed advisory outputs that inform decisions on green growth investments.

Telecom providers have access to appropriate technical and financial services for greening their network centers (telecom towers) that are currently diesel fueled, in remote locations and incur heavy logistics cost

description.narrative: Technically viable solar PV based solution proven and investment committed for the suggested implementation. Investment ticket estimated @ US$20-30M for viable implementation sites

title.narrative: Number of completed advisory outputs that inform decisions on green growth investments.
